content.p: With lots happening here at University of Nottingham Sport, please check out our news articles for all the latest news on our sports teams, programmes and more! The University of Nottingham has seen numerous students compete in international university competitions this summer, representing the university and their countries in martial arts and powerlifting. The stage is set for the Westfield Health British Transplant Games in Nottingham as an emotional baton relay sets off. At the recent TASS Practitioner Awards for 2024, the University of Nottingham saw two staff members receive recognition by winning national awards. A number of University of Nottingham connections, including current students and university alumni, will be representing their countries in Paris. The University of Nottingham were shortlisted for several awards at the 2024 BUCS Awards Dinner, hosted on Thursday 18th July at the University of Warwick. The University of Nottingham will be represented at the European University Games by our karate athletes, including club president and sport scholar Dylan Traves. Today marks just one month until the Touch World Cup kicks off in Nottingham and the first world championships to be hosted at the University of Nottingham. +44 (0)115 748 7000 sport@nottingham.ac.uk Find our opening times here.
